description: Erection of single storey rear extension (6m in depth, maximum height of 3.57m and eaves height of 2.53m)
decision_conditions: The proposed extension would extend beyond a wall forming a side elevation of the original dwellinghouse, and would have a width greater than half the width of the original dwellinghouse, in conflict with Paragraph A.1 (j) (iii) of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).
The proposed installation of soil and vent pipe is conflict with Paragraph A.1 (k) (iii) of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).
Conditions 3 (Materials) - Officers have reviewed the information and samples submitted and are satisifed that this condition can now be approved.

The applicant is informed that the submitted details for Condition 14 (Refuse and Recycling) and Condition 15 (Cycle Storage) of planning permission 20/01700/FUL have been assessed and are acceptable in isolation. However, given that it has been submitted as part of a package, it is refused.

The applicant Mr Matthew Evans had already used the free go scheme for the application 22/02519/FUL for the site Unit 2, The Griffin Centre, Market Place, KT1 1JT. There is no another free go for the same applicant and the same site. Free go is only one time for the same applicant and same site in whole life. Therefore this application is not entitle for a free go. The fee required for your planning application is Â£ 234.00.
